title: Article 8 : Shining a new light on biomimetic materials
description: Scientists have developed a dynamic material that reacts to a change in the environment. And here, this dynamic material reacts to light.

title: Article 7: Scouring the natural world can be an effective way of finding design inspiration for new scientific innovation. Here, we take a look at a crop of European biotechs currently using biomimicry to develop weird and wonderful bio-inspired products.
description: This article shows what biomimetic can bring to medicine so far. The articles tell us about examples of architecture, engineering ... But not yet in a purely medical environment. Three discoveries have been described.

title: Article 6 : Not all of nature's layered structures are tough as animal shells and antlers
description: This study shows us that you have to be critical with biomimicry. One should not naively take inspiration from the living without understanding its mechanisms. This article shows that certain living structures can be fragile. It is therefore necessary to analyse well before creating a non advantageous invention.

title: Article 5 : Biomimicry: Smart Design inspired by nature
description: This article is a summary such as the previous article on the arrival of biomimicry, explaining this concept. Concrete examples are also presented. For example, the kingfisher's beak inspired the shape of a train or the water pearls on a lotus leaf inspired hydrophobic materials. The article also describes the future that biomimicry can bring.

title: Article 4 : The Future of Design is Biomimicry
description: This article explains the arrival and the concept of biomimicry, and shows some concrete examples, especially in architecture. A product can contain multiple processes from nature. The Entropy carpet tiles are the proof.

title: Article 3 : Color-changing artificial 'chameleon skin' powered by nanomachines
description: The scientists are working on "a chameleon skin", it is a new nanotechnology allowing a modification of the color of a material according to the luminosity, this technology is inspired by several animals like the chameleon or the cuttlefish

title: Article 2 : A polar-bear-inspired material for heat insulation
description: The article is a study on polar bear fur, a polar bear must withstand extremely cold temperatures. And that to inspire scientists who have created a thermal insulator. This insulation and more efficient and lighter.

title: Article 1 : Mussels are inspiring new technology that could help purify water and clean up oil spills
description: This article discusses the many solutions to the problems that mussel can bring. Many studies are done on this organism. Produce super resistant adhesives, purify water, fight the oil spills ... All this will be possible with the mussels !
